string.title: String Length
string.paragraph: The length property returns the length of a string:

string.title: String charCodeAt, At()
string.paragraph: There are 4 methods for extracting string characters:</br> The at(position) Method.</br> The charAt(position) Method.</br> The charCodeAt(position) Method. </br> Using property access [] like in arrays but a little unpredictable

string.title: String slice, substring , substr
string.paragraph: There are 3 methods for extracting a part of a string:</br> slice(start, end)</br>substring(start, end)</br>substr(start, length)

string.title: String toUpper, toLower and concat
string.paragraph: A string is converted to upper case with toUpperCase(): </br> A string is converted to lower case with toLowerCase(): </br> concat() joins two or more strings:

string.title: String all trim methods
string.paragraph: The trim() method removes whitespace from both sides of a string:

string.title: String all pads methods
string.paragraph: It pads a string with another string (multiple times) until it reaches a given length.

string.title: String repeat methods
string.paragraph: The repeat() method returns a string with a number of copies of a string.</br>The repeat() method returns a new string.</br>The repeat() method does not change the original string.

string.title: String replace methods
string.paragraph: The replace() method replaces a specified value with another value in a string:

string.title: String split methods
string.paragraph: A string can be converted to an array with the split() method:
